title: Planetesimal
summary: Planetesimals /plænɪˈtɛsɪməlz/ are solid objects thought to exist in protoplanetary disks and debris disks. Per the Chamberlin–Moulton planetesimal hypothesis, they are believed to form out of cosmic dust grains. Believed to have formed in the solar system about 4.6 billion years ago, they aid study of its formation.
